intro: Claytonia compressa, commonly known as the smoothleaf springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and typically grows in moist, rocky soils along streambanks and woodland edges. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with succulent, smooth leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and bloom in early spring. Claytonia compressa is adapted to cool, humid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
